SENT.plain: We report the case of a woman who developed cerebral venous sinus thrombosis after an attempted epidural
The epidural was complicated by an accidental dural puncture and the ensuing headache was initially treated with an epidural blood patch
Cerebral venous sinus thrombosis is an uncommon condition with varying aetiology and risk factors

We discuss the importance of the differential diagnosis for postpartum headache and explore the relationship between cerebral venous sinus thrombosis and the triad of pregnancy, dural puncture and epidural blood patch
